meanings.sent1: I only need a smidge of sugar for my tea.
meanings.sent2: She added a smidge of salt to the soup for flavor.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added a smidge too much pepper to the dish.
meanings.sent4: His smile was just a smidge brighter than usual.
meanings.sent5: The tiny seed grew into a plant with just a smidge of water.

meanings.definition: To add a small amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: Can you smidge some more flour into the mixture?
meanings.sent2: She decided to smidge a bit of cinnamon into the recipe.
meanings.sent3: He likes to smidge extra cheese on his pizza.
meanings.sent4: The artist smidged a touch of blue to the painting for contrast.
meanings.sent5: Please smidge a pinch of salt into the sauce for me.
